org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsFileInputSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFileInputSocket

  • public class PwsFileInputSocket
extends java.lang.Object
    PwsFileInputSocket organises data input from an ordinary underlying data stream in order to read a persistent state of a PWS file and make its data content available to the user in a decrypted and convenient form. This takes care of decryption and unpacking depending on the different PWS file format versions in a way that lets the user ignore these differences.

    One instance of this socket can be used to obtain a single instance of either the block-stream or the raw-field reader. Before this, the socket must be opened through the attemptOpen() method, which can be performed repeatedly until the correct key (and file version) have been matched. An instance can be opened only once.

    NOTE: It is recommended that the data source input stream contains only the persistent state of a PWS file. For V3 files trailing extra data may be present in the stream but may get partly lost for subsequent users of the same input stream.

    See Also:
    PwsRawFieldReader, PwsBlockInputStream

    • Method Detail

      • attemptOpen

        public boolean attemptOpen(PwsPassphrase key)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to open this socket by trying a key on a PWS file of any format which is read from the supplied input stream starting at its current position. Repeated calls to this method (open attempts) are possible as long as previous calls have all rendered negative. This method tries out all known PWS file versions in combination with the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - the file access passphrase (secret key)
        Returns:
        true if and only if the socket could be opened (i.e. key matches)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this socket is already open
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during reading

      • attemptOpen

        public boolean attemptOpen(PwsPassphrase key,
                  int fileVersion)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           WrongFileVersionException,
                           UnsupportedFileVersionException
        Attempts to open this socket by trying a key on a PWS file of an optionally restricted format which is read from the supplied input stream starting at its current position. Repeated calls to this method (open attempts) are possible as long as previous calls have all rendered negative. This method allows to force a specific PWS file format version assumed.
        Parameters:
        key - the file access passphrase (secret key)
        fileVersion - if not 0, the specified file version is assumed (values as in Global)
        Returns:
        true if and only if the socket could be opened (i.e. key and version match)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if passphrase is undefined
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this socket is already open
        WrongFileVersionException - if a specific file format was requested and not found to match the file (V1, V2)
        UnsupportedFileVersionException - if V3 format was requested and corrupted data was encountered
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred during reading

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Whether this input socket is open.
        Returns:
        true if and only if one of the "attemptOpen" methods has been performed successfully on this socket

      • getFileVersion

        public int getFileVersion()
        Returns the PWS file format version (for values see class Global) or 0 if the file has not been opened.
        Returns:
        int file format version

      • getBlocksize

        public int getBlocksize()
        Returns the blocksize of the cipher used to decrypt this socket's input stream or 0 if this socket has not been opened.
        Returns:
        int cipher blocksize or 0

      • getRawFieldReader

        public PwsRawFieldReader getRawFieldReader()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a specialised iterator over all raw-fields of the underlying PWS database. Serves for reading all PWS file data contents.
        Returns:
        RawFieldReader
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the socket is not open or another input stream has been active for this socket
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs or the stream is corrupted

      • getBlockInputStream

        public PwsBlockInputStream getBlockInputStream()
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Renders a block based input stream of the PWS file data content. The stream is positioned to the first block after the file header.
        Returns:
        PwsBlockInputStream
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the socket is not open or another input stream has been active for this socket
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs or the stream is corrupted

      • close

        public void close()

      • getOptions

        public java.lang.String getOptions()
        Returns the file's options string; available when socket is open. If the file format does not support an option string, an empty string is returned.

        For format V2 files this value represents the same data field that is also used by PasswordSafe (PWS). For format V3 it represents a JPWS specific data field (which is not an element of the PWS canon). The PWS specific preferences of a V3 file can be obtained by getHeaderFields().getField(PwsFileHeaderV3.PWS_PREFS_TYPE).getString("utf-8").

        Returns:
        String file options text

      • getReadChecksum

        public byte[] getReadChecksum()
        Returns the hash function verification code encountered at the end of a V3 file. This code serves to verify integrity of user data. This information can only be available after EOF of the input block stream has been reached; it may not be available at all.
        Returns:
        byte[] file hmac of length 32 or null if this information is unavailable

      • getIterations

        public int getIterations()
        The number of security iterations of key calculation during file authentication. (Note this property is only available for file format V3.)
        Returns:
        number of calculation iterations or 0 if unavailable

      • getCalcChecksum

        public byte[] getCalcChecksum()
        Returns the hash function checksum calculated over all read raw-field data of a V3 file.

        This code serves to verify integrity of user data. This information can only be available after EOF of the input block stream has been reached; it may not be available at all.

        Returns:
        byte[] file hmac of length 32 or null if this information is unavailable

      • getHeaderFields

        public HeaderFieldList getHeaderFields()
        Returns the field list of the file header if it is available. This is valid only for format V3, otherwise null is returned. (The header field list may contain various data elements referring to the file in total.)
        Returns:
        RawFieldList or null

      • getFileUUID

        public UUID getFileUUID()
        Returns the UUID identifier for the PWS file if it is available.
        Returns:
        file UUID or null if this information is not available
